normalised: five G rollout gains momentum across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 - The nationwide 5G rollout continues at a rapid pace, with telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio aggressively expanding their networks. Latest data from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) indicates significant progress in key metropolitan areas and Tier-II cities.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three - The nationwide five G rollout continues at a rapid pace, with telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio aggressively expanding their networks. Latest data from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) indicates significant progress in key metropolitan areas and Tier-two cities.

unnormalised: "We are witnessing a transformative shift in India's digital landscape," stated Dr. Aruna Sharma, Director of IIT Delhi's Center for Telecom Technology and Management. "The enhanced connectivity promised by 5G will unlock new opportunities for businesses and consumers alike, reminiscent of the technological leaps depicted in Bollywood films like 'Robot', but with tangible real-world impact."
normalised: "We are witnessing a transformative shift in India's digital landscape," stated Dr. Aruna Sharma, Director of I I T Delhi's Center for Telecom Technology and Management. "The enhanced connectivity promised by five G will unlock new opportunities for businesses and consumers alike, reminiscent of the technological leaps depicted in Bollywood films like 'Robot', but with tangible real-world impact."

unnormalised: Reliance Jio has reportedly covered over 25,000 km of fiber optic cable in the past quarter alone, while Bharti Airtel is focusing on densifying its existing 5G network. Industry analysts project that 5G subscriptions will reach 150 million by the end of 2024. The average 5G download speed is currently clocked at 500 Mbps, approximately 10 times faster than 4G. Investments in the sector are estimated to be upwards of Rs. 3 lakh crore.
normalised: Reliance Jio has reportedly covered over twenty five thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable in the past quarter alone, while Bharti Airtel is focusing on densifying its existing five G network. Industry analysts project that five G subscriptions will reach one hundred and fifty million by the end of two thousand and twenty four. The average five G download speed is currently clocked at five hundred M B P S, approximately ten times faster than four G. Investments in the sector are estimated to be upwards of rupee three lakh crore.
